reviews.text: Thank you so much for this nice place. I hope the time will arise, that people smoke their weed in peace. As the museum shows, there is a long and rich tradition of doing so. This helps to get founded knowledge beyond of just lobbying. It gets clear, that there is no real argument against liberalization. Instead the question arises which lobby prevent legalization and why. It was much more to see than possible, as the museum contains a lot of art and music, but also background information more than possible to read.

First of all, there i so many information! If you want to listen everything, to see every exhibit, reserve at least three hours. The interior is splendid, it;s up to you which way you want to visit. In summary, it's definitely worth to go there.
If you are looking for an unusual and interesting way to spend an hour this is right for you! Close to La Ramblas.
Very helpful staff informative museum a little small my very interesting, shame that my card I'm Amsterdam is not taken in
Interesting facts and pieces to look at. Good translatio feature they give you and a funny photobooth you can email yourself pictures from.
A different and good experience. Good collection of pieces. The audio book and the placement of the  pieces could be better.
A very worthwhile museum to visit if it is of interest to you. Small but very well presented and informative.

The museum is located in an historic building in down town Barcelona rich in history, it even has a chapel inside. The museum is fabulous and a true eye opener. This will be of interest to anyone. We loved our visit.

It was very nice to see. It has very good information and quality information about the hemp. The museum is presenting facts about how the people in the history were using the fibers of hemp to make inventions, quality and useful things and every picture, wall or object has a story to say. It's a must see in Barcelona!
.. Was the oldest weed bud. But also the old bongs and ships were great. All in all i loved everything. Was very interesting and its a wonderful idea with the speakers. makes it much more easier

This was my first museum stop in Barcelona (out of at least 10) and I’d have to say it was in my top three visits just underneath the Erotica Museum. The museum is located in a very historic and majestic building decorated with many different historic and interesting paraphernalia. It wasn’t too crowded during the day and the museum staff were very friendly. A++

I honestly found the explanation in the audioguide poors in informations and facts and kinda too focused in making me want to buy hemp and I hope it was just a really bad translation. The explanation about the modernist building are also not suficent but if you like to just look at stuff (that could be super interesting but lack in explanation) and then get to the souvenir shop is more than enough.

Very interesting and amazing tour throughout the history of hash, marihuana and hemp. Helpful and useful especially for people with prejudices. Iam going to visit Barcelona again and hope visiting you again.
Great job. Very smart and interesting. Beautiful building and many things to discover. I'll come back :)

.. Change the name to Hash Cannabis & Hemp Museum. Throw out that crappy, racist word "Marihuana" out the window....
otherwise it was a knowledgeable visit and a lot of nice things to look at. 
/Uffe

The probably biggest exhibition of cannabis history in the world is located in a building not short of a treasure itself.. We visited on the morning, had lunch, a joint and a cervesa or two and went back. Spent a good two more hours in there. The display of old tools, writings on and about hemp and the collection of masterpieces is incredible. Not to mention the customer glass-stained windows and gorgeous entry.

I thought the museum was very Grand just like the sweet Mary Jane. I thought I learnt an awful lot and viewed some pieces of art on the way. It comes with an audio guide within the price so reading wasn’t a problem!
For such a great Museum in Barcelona. All very much, especially stained glass and Shakespeare =) I will definitely advise my friends to visit.

Coming from the United States it was nice to be able to visit this museum. Nothing like it has ever materialized in the US. If you have any interest in the topic, Please go and support this museum. I’m sure it costs a lot of money for rent and keeping it running. They take donations of your rare collectibles!

Loved both the very interesting information about hemp and the amazing building this museum is located in. 
The audio guide is fantastic and delivers a huge amount of facts about both hemp and the building. 
Little known museum, well worth the visit.

This museum had a really good audioguide and a nice system for using it. It also provided some interesting information about the history of hemp and marijuana. However, it was a bit small for the price (probably not subsidised as some other museums are), and it pushed the legalization agenda pretty forcefully (I support it, but it took away from the museum experience).

2 hour interesting stuff. 

Start with the general plant <3 
History and how to use/used hemp.
more History <3 
Medice
nice smalltalks everywhere 

thx and love for this museum
Very informative, but there should be a video that shows how hemp, cbd, and other properties are extracted from the plant.
Very informative, not just about the obvious recreational use of hash but the use of hemp in industry, textiles and medicine.
Loved it! Very educational. Especially for people who are against weed . It will help them realize it’s not such a bad thing . The whole place was adorable. Great location and gift shop

Ths was the best and more than reasonably priced museum/tour that we did in 3 weeks in europe. My expectations were low but was pleasantly surprised about how much I did not know about the history of marijuana and it's many therapeutic uses.

The Museum is in a nice historic building. The price is very fair, with included audio guide. You can learn a lot about hemp usage in the past and all the possible use of hemp. There are also products exposed, such as shoes or chairs..which was interesting to see.
The location is good, in city center, easy to find.

I was there with my girlfriend and it was just simply awesome, its really awesome. Full of information about Marihuana and Hemp. Its a place to visit. section by section worth listening to. We will definitely be back.
Very informative. It was good to see how hemp was used throughout the years and interesting to see how many things can be made from it, even car panels!
Lovely interesting museum, full of interesting facts.. would recommend people go visit. I was surprised how good it was.

This is a must on all To-Do lists when visiting Barcelona. It’s very educational and the artifacts are fascinating! Be sure to visit the gift shop. I wish we purchased more than one lighter. And the tote bag is huge, I just love it.
I really enjoyed the museum, it was not too long but had a lot of interesting information. It was delivered in a nice firm of an audioguide. Also loved the interactive part😄

The museum was a little hard to find down some typical Barcelona streets but was a lot of fun and located in a beautiful old gothic style house. It’s quite educational for people who smoke or those who don’t. There’s also a free green screen photo booth that’s a lot of fun. My friend and I went here after picking up a token in a bar that entitled you to a free souvenir upon entry so we left with a cool fridge magnet too! If you go check in the guest sign in book for my cool drawing of a marijuana leaf 🤙
So informative and generally interesting way to spend your afternoon. Being fans of smoking we found it well worth the visit.

The Hash Marihuana & Hemp Museum is located in the Barri Gottic neighborhood of Barcelona. Very romantic setting of cobbled streets and late 1800s to early 1900s architecture. The museum was part of a palace complex called Palau Mornau built in the 16th century. In the early 20th century the famous architect of Catalan Modernism Manuel Raspal was commissioned to renovate and extend the building. The inside is quite extensive with very informative displays of the history of the herb. Most of the staff can speak English and a few other European languages so no one is totally lost. So spending the whole afternoon while the locals take their siestas is well worth a visit to this museum.
Considering the name, some things could be improved, but overall, a good and simpatic tour with some interesting facts and things.

I totally agree with the excellent reviews of this museum!  It is not quite so extensive as the one in Amsterdam, but the fabulous architecture of the building more than makes up for it.  I loved that the narration included information about the house as well ... An excellent choice for a museum tour in Barcelona!

The Hash Marihuana and Hemp Museum is located in a gorgeous building near the Gothic Quarter that was once a palace home in the 1500s. It has been renovated to it's glory and filled with an incredible array of artifacts about the past history and present uses of the cannabis plant. It has a wonderful audioguide to walk you through it, and is just a fun place to hang out. It has a sister museum in Amsterdam that is also fantastic. It should be on every cannabis lover's must see list, but it is also worthwhile for those who just want to visit a cool museum.

Very nice interactive audioguides, a large and well described collection of artefacts, pictures and videos. Spent an hour at least to learn about everything, could spend more. Definitely recommend to visit when in Barcelona!

Superb little museum. Filled with an array of pictures, stories, films and artefacts all related to Hash, Marijuana and Hemp. Fascinating to read about and watch the propaganda film 'Reefer Madness': it was an absolute hoot; hilarious.

Small but wonderful place to visit if you have the time. Building is beautiful and full of things to see. We spent about an hour looking over everything and both me and my wife were happy about our time spent there.

We went along with an open mind and really enjoyed ourselves!It was enlightening,educational and gave you valuable insight to the use of hemp.Marijuana and hashish over the centuries.It had an interactive photo machine and the building housing it was gorgeous!Worth a visit!Our hosts were lovely too!

A refreshing idea, well researched, documented and presented in a beautiful historic townhouse. particularly relevant as attitudes to recreational/medicinal Marijuana are changing around the world, and renewable crops, such as hemp, are bing re-evaluated.
This museum features many artefacts of hemp culture, some dating back to hundreds of years. A really nice place, the museum is located in an ancient palace in the center of the city.

I have visited both hemp museums in Amsterdam and Barcelona and I have to say the Barcelona hemp museum was much more informative! (In all fairness I visited the Amsterdam one about 7 years ago so it could have underwent some improvements by now). However the Barcelona hemp museum shows so much history of how the plant has been used through the centuries, they go as far as explaining how it was used by the Egyptians, in wars, car manufacturers.. the uses of this plant are endless, they also give an insight into the visions and plans for it’s future uses. It explains how the discrimination against the plant arouse, and association with other drugs, that gives it a bad name today. They also add a free photo op which I thought was a really nice touch, it’s not a busy place so u have time to enjoy all of the museum. The staff downstairs were really helpful and they even offer to look after your belongings while you walk around. If you want to get a better understanding of hemp or marijuana, this is the place to visit.

Absolutely great museum - very  informative, well prepared and absolutely cool to visit with entire family as it shows the entire history of cannabis, different aspects of it`s use with some cultural context. Highly recommend to absolutely everyone to visit !
Beautiful building with loads of amazing old world style. The memorabilia going back since the days of snake oil. Was shocking! Def worth a stop.

The staff were great from the start and very helpful. Speaking English was very helpful too.
The information gained from the automated recordings was very interesting and the use of hemp throughout the centuries was surprising. Some great stories and articles about the whole subject too.
Afterwards I bought some seeds and the information given regarding the different strains was reassuring and informative.
If you are genuinely interested in hash and hemp, give yourself at least 1.5 hours to really listen to all the recordings and to view the artefacts. They're worth it!

I went by myself on a rainy day and just got super baked and took my time listening to all the spiels the guide could play!  It's really an informative museum on the pop culture of weed, but really excels in the industrial hemp exhibits!  So much history and in a really pretty old castle on a really cool old street.
Beautiful building. Nice and quiet compared to outside Barcelona. Audio guide interesting and informative.
It was really interactive! The museum is quite large and has a ton to look at! Definitely learned quite a bit!
Great place but we haven't received the free picture promised when you give your mail... instead, just spams from partners....
More people must visit this museum to discover the truth about Cannabis! Open your eyes! I highly recommend
Really interesting and informative museum on the history, cultivation and use (both industrial and recreational) of marijuana and hemp. Well worth a visit

This museum is absolutely fascinating and beautiful building! I spent at least 3 hours in there during a low tourist season and thoroughly enjoyed it. Rich history of use and modern applications. HIGHLY RECOMMEND A VISIT and take your time! :) PS I actually visited in Feb 2018 but did not have this date to select.
Located in the stunning Palau Mornau, this interesting and unusual museum is well worth a visit. Great value for money.

The museum completely changed my view on hemp through its thorough and interesting displays.  The audio segments available in most of the rooms were informative.  

Hemp used in Bugatti and Mercedes automobiles, among others.  Pres. Clinton banning the importation of Adidas athletic shoes with hemp uppers.  How smoking marijuana gives you a high, smoking hemp gives you a headache.  How we grew thousands of acres of hemp during WW2 to braid into rope for battleships.

Well worthwhile.  Highly recommended.
very interresting place retracing the history of the plant and how its reliated to the city and historicaly why

We have found this museum accidentally, but we are very happy about that. Everything was great - the staff was very kind and helpful. In the museum there is a lot to see and hear. The whole museum is full of paintings, drawings, old records, books, etc.
It tells the story of cannabis and it`s possibilities of use.
It was wonderful. Very detailed descriptions and facts. The audio guide was very helpful .Thanks a lot

Interesting central avenue from which myriad lanes lead to fascinating old areas. La Rambla is lined with restaurants, shops, buskers and , sad to say, pickpockets. Worth a visit but hang onto your valuables.

Although there is a small section on the whole Cheech and Chong side, the major part of this museum is about the many uses of hemp as an eco-friendly, extremely versatile, quick growing plant.
The beautiful 450yr old building was renovated by the museum's Dutch founder who apparently is somewhat of a hemp entrepreneur and advocate. 
My only criticism would be that there seem to be several historical paintings of people smoking pipes and these are automatically suggested that they are smoking weed where in all probability, they're just smoking tobacco. I thought it was unnecessary to do that. Keep it honest, keep it true.
About 9 euros entry which includes an audio guide in the language of your choice.

From the outside it gets your attention straight away. The building is really beautiful! The museum itself isn’t that big, but a lot of people say it’s really small but i don’t think it’s too small or anything. There are a lot of product, art and explainings. When you come inside you get a recorder and get to choose to have a audio tour. I liked that there was next to the use for smoking, Advertisements, medicine and culture also a part about the fabrics.
Free translation gadget per customer too - no extra cost which was pleasant surprise. Beautiful building as well. Recommend
This underrated museum is in the heart of the city and attracts very few tourists, mostly youngsters. I enjoyed all the displays at the museum. was quite a good experience :) Totally recommended!!

We were not aware of this museum but saw a sign for it as we emerged from a nearby subway. Glad we did. The Museum has lots of interesting things and unusual features. It could be brought more up to date (e.g. legalization in Canada and Uruguay, medical and personal use in many US state). Nonetheless, it's worth the trip.
Educating, inspiring, beautiful, funky and Good location.Go there and find out all the benefits with hemp. You can build chairs out of hemp. Wow!
They had a lot of interesting facts and history on marijuana. The actual museum is in an old mansion

This is a real "don't miss nestled on one of the Barri Gotic neighborhoods many narrow, cobbled streets. The Museum is located in a beautifully restored example of Barcelona's modernista at Carrer Ample 35. The two floors of the museum cover everything from the medicinal history of cannabis to its place in Spanish industrial history to the Fabulous Furry Freak Bros. The setting is divine and the ornately carved viewing cases a great education.

A nice slip away museum in the middle of busy tourist Barcelona. Packed with celebrity memorabilia, hemp creations, womderful Dutch oil paintings, Cheech amd Chong posters, a comprehensive, fun, entertaining and information collection of things associated with the ‘Devil Weed’.So worth a drop in vist!
Even if you are not into hemp and its history, the building itself is aready amazing. Go there and find out how great it is

Thus is slightly hidden away and was fairly quiet when we visited, which made it a very pleasant hour plus. There is a detailed audio guide which consists of a podcatcher so it means you can go riound at your leisure and in any order. The buidling it is housed in is fascinating too, and I would recommend it for architecture lovers as well as those interseted in hemp and marijuana.
Its really interesting. Shows a side you wouldn't see. It was a very in depth look into the history and politics of marijuana. Why its been seen as bad. There was a gift shop.
The building is absolutely stunning! I also learned a lot about the uses for hemp and saw a lot of interesting objects and memorabilia. The free audio guide was very useful.
Amazing place to learn about The history of Hemp and Marijuana. We have learned so much during our visit! Totally recommend it!

This was an informative, entertaining and surprisingly elegant looking museum (for its subject matter).  Based in a vintage looking house, it offers a pretty comprehensive look at the history of these increasingly mainstream plants, as a recreational drug, medicinal treatment, and hemp as a very useful material
This museum was absolutely wonderful! The building is stunning and the self-paced audio descriptions of all the artifacts was very impressive. The staff was welcoming, helpful, and friendly.
It was very nice to learn more about the history and to collect new information. I also find the construction of the museum very good from the old days to the new ones
I enjoyed it. You get to learn back in the day how much they relied on hemp for everything. Also all its benefits. Worth a visit.
We were excited. We learned a lot about cannabis. Opening hours up to 22 hour are great. We definitely recommend a visit.

This museum helps to open the eyes to the amazing hemp plant and all it's uses.  Sadly, most governments have foolishly outlawed the plant in all it's forms.  Time for a change!  Hemp is a miracle plant when you consider its hundreds of uses, many of which are far superior to the conventional methods currently in place in my country (USA) and many others!  Check this place out if you're in Barcelona.  Educate.  You won't regret it!

Well worth a visit just for the building that has been restored to its former glory. I hope we once again start to use hemp as an every day product. If you do visit here you will also come away wondering why we do not. Very good self guided tour with lots of information, seek out the bit about the US promoting the use of hemp in the was. Give yourself about 90 mins to give this place justice
Do not get me wrong, I am not a pothead but I found this place quite interesting. Beautiful building, lots of interesting facts about hemp. Worth a visit

The visit to the museum is interesting because it takes you through the history of using and banning cannabis. It is beautifully shown what can be done from industrial cannabis and why it is called a plant of the future.
Very nice museum, lots of great information and exhibits.  The building itself is worth seeing, just beautiful!

We visited this museum in early May and found it very worthwhile. Housed in a beautifully restored aristocratic townhouse, it traces hemp's history in a thorough and enjoyable way, using artefacts and artworks to detail its many practical uses as well as its psychedelic ones!. The audio guide was a stand-out, as you accessed points within each room as you reached them, rather than responding to one long directive, a boring and often confusing offering we'd tried and rejected at other European sites. 
The lady at the desk had excellent English, was extremely well-informed about her museum and Catalonia's current situation in Spain, and acted as a wonderful ambassador for her country.
Overall, this was a highlight of our trip to Barcelona.

I was extremely impressed with the information and collections that was presented at the museum.   I am health educator and feel the the use of Marijuana has been demonized unjustly.  Also, I want to add that this building is amazingly worth a visit, it is  georgious.
Easy to use audio tour, nice and clean installations, good layout and well planned. I liked the examples of hemp craftsmanship.
Very cool building pretty architecture. Finding out the history and stories was very interesting. NIce friendly staff. Worth it if u got some time free in barcelona

I really enjoyed this museum as it was interactive and I love the portable device which you place onto a picture in the museum and then it talks to you and explains the history this provided them more interactive elements to a typical Museum and didn't make it boring. Also that in-house shop had a variety of items from pure hemp herbal tea to cannabis seeds to cannabis oil lollipops

My son and I went to this museum. It is laid out beautifully. The antiquities were particularly interesting to me. It was a bit hard to find and locals didn't seem to know about it while trying to find it. The recorded stop points was very informative.

I liked it. I learned  things, saw some interesting exhibits. It was fun. The building itself is very nice.
I wish some of the curation was a bit better. I think the whole thing can taken to the next level but I really enjoyed the exibits and learning things about these special plants that I did not know.
This museum explains to u the history of hemp and marijuana and their multiple uses and benifits. Very interesting place to visit!

A very comprehensive museum on hemp uses and cannabis.  Learned that hemp is a nutritious animal feed, can be used to make building blocks to build houses, and textiles!  We should be legalizing cannabis for recreational and medicinal use.  Follow Canada!
Really educational fun visit for parents and teenagers. Super well done audio tour automatically included in the 9 lb admission ticket. Definitely worth including in a Barcelona visit!
Everything you need to know about the history of hemp and the pervasive role it played in society before it was vilified as a sex-inducing and evil, addictive drug.

Many historical artifacts. I learned a lot about these plants that I did not know. The building is beautiful. The exhibits very well curated. Very engaging, interesting and educational. I think anyone who really took the time to look, listen and learn there would vote for legalization.
I really enjoyed visiting the Hash Marihuana & Hemp Museum. For 9 euros you get an audioguide plus there is a free, fun photo booth! Loved all the historical information. Very fun!

Regardless of personal feelings, beliefs and biases, this museum has something to offer everyone. It's educational, interesting and very thorough. Rooms in this beautiful modernisme-style residence cover history, religions, books, films, medicine, cultivation and more. Definitely one of the highlights of my visit to Barcelona.

Very interesting with the old history, and all that Medical perpuse instead of it being a drug. And so much you can do with the oil, besides using it as a drug.
A nice informative museum but not so big and a bit expensive to go in (9 euro per person).
